results.title: Tugboat Mickey
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Gang’s All Here”
Tugboat Captain Mickey hears what he thinks is a distress signal from a sinking ship and orders his two man crew to the rescue. Their energetic ineptitude leads from one mishap to another.

group_works.title: The World at one (TEFC)
group_works.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University

results.title: The World at one (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The First Years of Life Pt. 3”.
A study of four girls around their first birthday. Shows how all children develop at a different pace, and how they are beginning to make sense of the world around them. Demonstrates some games you can play with one year olds that will show you how much they understand.

group.title: The First Years of Life Pt. 3

results.title: The Invaders
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts for Life”.
Looks at the different ways in which infections - mainly bacteria, (causing, for example, dental caries, sore throats, typhoid fever and whooping cough) and viruses (causing the common cold, measles, small pox and polio) can invade the body, and the way in which they can be treated, controlled or prevented.

results.title: The Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts for Life”.
Examines the demands placed upon the heart and lungs, demonstrated by treadmill experiments in the laboratory. Shows that causes of heart diseases are aggravated by over-eating and lack of exercise and that lung damage can be caused by smoking and air pollution.

results.title: In a cleaner greener land
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
This film deals with the enormous problems of pollution of the air, the water and the land. All three are dealt with in detail but the pollution of the air is given greater attention in this timely film.

results.title: Contraception
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The most important aspect of family planning is to avoid the unwanted child. Baroness Birk describes to young people the irresponsibility of creating such a child and the damaging psychological, radical and social effects on both the child and the parents. Advice for young people on all types of sexual matters is provided by Family Planning Association Clinics and Brooke Advisory Centre. An animated sequence on the mechanic of conception is included.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.
